stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

stadium.name: The Serpent's Pass
stadium.location: Zmeigorod, just west of the lumber mill
stadium.description: Has to be periodically rebuilt whenever the old stadium starts sinking into the swamp. Don’t worry about it.

stats.pregame_ritual: Rubbing a foul-smelling local mushroom on their elbows for flexibility.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Polishing their helmet with a live snail for good luck.
Tensing every muscle in their body at once, then releasing.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Looking each teammate in the eye and giving a single, firm nod.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Painting a single, matching stripe of mud on each player's face.
Polishing their helmet with a live snail for good luck.
Sharing a ceremonial, non-alcoholic grog from a communal cup.
Looking each teammate in the eye and giving a single, firm nod.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.

Tensing every muscle in their body at once, then releasing.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.

preGame:
Hello Osterra! Step right up and lean in close, because playoff fever is higher than a warlock's ego! Nok the Corrupter here, coming to you live from Fletchings Field for Game 2 of this nail-biting Best of 3! The Zmeigorod Snessengers are on the ropes after dropping Game 1, and let me tell you, the atmosphere is thicker than a swamp-troll's skull! The fans—bless their deluded hearts—have turned out in droves! This place is packed to the rafters with Zmeigorod faithful, all hoping the Bog Queen Valos has blessed their boots today.

On the other side, we've got Oak & Onslaught, looking to close this series out right here on their home turf! I saw Abner Seidel earlier, and those garishly colored undergarments he’s wearing for luck are bright enough to blind a basilisk! Meanwhile, Evalyn Pierrepont of the Snessengers was seen giving his helmet a final shine with a very confused-looking live snail. If that’s what passes for strategy in the Grove, it’s no wonder they’re down a game!

The druids have been busy too! Fletchings Field is looking absolutely treacherous with trees and gullies shifting around like a drunken adventurer after a night at Yarp's casino. It’s a beautiful day for a bit of the old ultra-violence, and with the Warden’s Watch looking on, every hit is going to feel just a bit more official. Will the Snessengers snap back, or will the Wardens' wood-walkers send them packing? Let’s find out!
postGame:
Sweet misery! What a finish! The Zmeigorod Snessengers have pulled a rabbit out of the hat—or maybe a snail out of a helmet—and tied this series up at 1-1! They walked into Fletchings Field and snatched a 4-3 victory that has the local Warden fans weeping into their organic tea!

The game started with a flurry of activity in Center Field as Teria Ravo snagged the ball, but the highlight of the early minutes was absolute carnage! Millham Evangeline of the home team didn't waste any time, absolutely walloping Arni Griffith and sending him straight to the healer’s tent! That’s the kind of sportsmanship I love to see!

Not to be outdone, Ema Ulrick decided to test the structural integrity of Northway Orran’s ribs. A beautiful tackle that left Northway seeing stars and the Snessengers looking a bit thin on the bench! It seemed like the Onslaught was going to bully their way to a series sweep early on.

But hold your horses! After Alded Sanjay intercepted a wild pass from Hole Bowerman, the Snessengers showed they weren't just here to be punching bags. The momentum shifted as Avaria Revell and Gere Cordelie started advancing that leather head with purpose, weaving through the druid-placed trees!

Hole Bowerman did give the home crowd something to cheer about, though! She wound up from the Home Field and launched a magnificent Shoot that sailed right into the basket for 2 points! Sir Randy probably couldn't have done better with his fancy-schmancy bow!

Zmeigorod answered back with a laser-focused shot from Avaria Revell, keeping things tighter than a money priest's purse strings! The halftime whistle blew with both teams looking like they'd been through a meat grinder, and the healers had their work cut out for them revival-wise!

After the break, Milt Casady decided to go on a rampage. He tracked down Dare Wynnie and Delija Dowling, delivering back-to-back hits that were so loud they probably woke up the God King Artorias from his celebrity nap! It was a masterclass in brutality that briefly put the Onslaught back in control.

However, the Snessengers are nothing if not resilient! Despite the shifting terrain of Fletchings Field trying to trip them up at every turn, they kept their composure. Even when Arni Griffith decided to take his revenge by flattening Wynnie Faina, the focus remained on the goal!

Milt Casady thought he’d sealed the deal with a spectacular run into the End Zone, dunking the ball for a touchdown that brought the house down! The score was 3-2 for the home team, and it looked like the Snessengers were headed for the loser's bracket.

But then came the hero of the hour—Alded Sanjay! With the pressure of the playoffs weighing on his shoulders, he lined up a shot from the 2-Point zone and nailed it! That final four-point total secured the win for Zmeigorod, forcing a Game 3 and keeping the Bog Queen's dreams alive! What a game! What a series! We're going to a decider!
